result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus C Mallory

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus C Mallory not in court, in custody. 
Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Marcus C Mallory.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for  William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Court waived defendant appearance due to  his in custody status.
Defense waiting for outcome of defendant pending matter in Waukesha County and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus C Mallory not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Marcus C Mallory.   
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request an adjournment. 
Defense advises the court defendant has a revocation hearing on 10-13-2022.
 Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (13 pages) commencing 08-08-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Marcus C Mallory in court, appear by video with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley, appear by video.  Defendant Marcus C Mallory in custody.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to 3 prior OWI'S. Sworn for the State: Whitefish Bay Officer H. Miller.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Hartley.

Adjustment Number: 22A 075261,
Payable Number: 1024409,
Receipt Number: 22RP031534,
Amount: $20.00

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision LEVEL 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Marcus C Mallory in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Marcus C Mallory in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcus C Mallory appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
